titles.title: Education and Training Affordability Act of 1997
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a deduction for higher education expenses.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Education and Training Affordability Act of 1997 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an individual a deduction for the amount of qualified higher education expenses paid by the individual. Limits the amount allowed to $5,000 ($2,500 in case of a married individual filing separately). Provides for a limitation based on modified adjusted gross income and other limitations.
